conclusion: Analyze v-t graphs to determine positions and calculate distances to find maximum distance between cars.

Car A has constant velocity of 40 m/s from t=10s to t=20s, then remains at 40 m/s from t=20s to t=30s. Car B has constant velocity of 40 m/s from t=10s to t=20s, then increases linearly from 40 m/s to 80 m/s from t=20s to t=30s.
Both cars start side by side at t=10s with a velocity of 40 m/s.
At t=20s, both cars have traveled 200 meters each, maintaining side-by-side positions.
From t=20s to t=30s, car A remains stationary at 40 m/s, while car B accelerates from 40 m/s to 80 m/s.
Distance traveled by car A between t=20s and t=30s is 0 meters.
Distance traveled by car B between t=20s and t=30s is calculated using equation of motion, resulting in 24000 meters.
Maximum distance between car A and car B is 24000 meters.
